description: Relatively recent (late 20th century) spelling of bull-like.

adjectives.description: bulllike (comparative more bulllike, superlative most bulllike)

entries.meaning: Resembling or characteristic of a bull.
examples: 1973, J. A. B. van Buitenen (tr.), transl., The Mahābhārata‎[1], Book 1, page 314:So these bulllike men queried the brahmin, O king, and he told them the entire story of the birth of Draupadí.

adverbs.description: bulllike (comparative more bulllike, superlative most bulllike)

entries.meaning: In a manner similar to a bull.
examples: He was breathing bulllike from anger.
